title: Jeffrey Wasserstrom: China, Xi Jinping, Trade War, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Mao | Lex Fridman Podcast #466

metadata.summary: In this episode, Lex Fridman and Jeffrey Wasserstrom delve into the complexities of modern China. They explore the rise of Xi Jinping and his personality cult, drawing parallels to Mao Zedong's era. The conversation covers Confucianism's influence, the Tiananmen Square protests, censorship tactics, and the dynamics of the trade war with the US. Wasserstrom provides insights into the situations in Taiwan and Hong Kong, the future of China, and the impact of interconnectedness on global politics.

topClaims.text: Xi Jinping has established a sustained personality cult similar to that of Mao Zedong.
The 1989 Tiananmen Square protests were an effort to get the Communist Party in China to live up to its own stated ideals.
The image of the man in front of a line of tanks symbolizes that the Chinese government had lost the mandate to rule.
China's governance during the COVID lockdowns reflected a blend of both *Brave New World* and *1984* styles of control.
Xi Jinping may escalate military action against Taiwan due to a sense of desperation and losing popularity.

topQuotes.text: Xi Jinping is the first leader in China since him who has had a sustained personality cult.
The students say, No, you know, we're just trying to show our patriotism.
The image was of the government as having lost the mandate to rule.
During the COVID lockdowns, people were being so intensely monitored and controlled.
Given Xi Jinping's emphasis on the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation, unification with Taiwan is a crucial part of his vision for China.

topTopics.name: xi jinping
topTopics.description: The current leader of China and his policies.

topTopics.name: mao zedong
topTopics.description: The former leader of China and his legacy.

topTopics.name: hong kong protests
topTopics.description: The protests and their impact on China.

topTopics.name: chinese censorship
topTopics.description: The censorship methods used in China.

topTopics.name: taiwan china
topTopics.description: The relationship between China and Taiwan.

metadata.shortSummary: Lex Fridman interviews Jeffrey Wasserstrom, a historian of modern China, discussing Xi Jinping, Mao Zedong, censorship, trade wars, Taiwan, and the future of China.
